definition: minefield (lit. and fig.)
surname Lei
thunder/mine (weapon)/(Internet slang) terrifying/terrific
area/region/district/small/distinguish/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Ou

sentences.english: This area is a minefield, and difficult to play directly.
sentences.chinese: 這個領域是一個雷區，難以直接參與。

sentences.english: But the GM tobacco would be able to assess an entire field.
sentences.chinese: 但是轉基因菸草將可以檢查整片雷區。

sentences.english: A directed energy beam would scan the area from above.
sentences.chinese: 定向能源束從上空掃描雷區。

sentences.english: Politics and minefields, press and P.
Approaching Tripoli our ships ran into a new minefield.
sentences.chinese: 在駛近的黎波里港時，我們的船隻進入一個新佈雷區。

sentences.english: Social media is a minefield for the unwary.
sentences.chinese: 但社交網站是還那些粗心大意者的雷區。

sentences.english: He sprang from the minefield with surprising agility.
sentences.chinese: 他異常敏捷地跳離佈雷區。

sentences.english: oogle “just ran into a huge minefield.”
sentences.chinese: Google“剛剛闖入了巨大的佈雷區。”

sentences.english: Both the income statements and balance sheets of insurers can be minefields.
sentences.chinese: 保險公司的資產負債表和利潤表都有可能是雷區。

definition: to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
trivial matter/a piece of cake
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to have no sense of shame/brazen
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
(automobile) sedan/car
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
